item.title: How to Start Wsl in Linux User Home
item.author: rouke@broersma.dev (Rouke Broersma)
item.description: While using the Windows Terminal with WSL and Ubuntu I was bothered by the fact that I would always start in my Windows user home. Luckily there are ways to fix that.

item.title: Hugo Modules for Themes
item.author: rouke@broersma.dev (Rouke Broersma)
item.description: The hugo tutorial tells you to use git submodules for themes. However hugo has a better system for dependencies called modules. Let you show you in short how to switch from git submodules to hugo modules!

item.title: Why I chose Hugo
item.author: rouke@broersma.dev (Rouke Broersma)
item.description: This blog is currently powered by Hugo, a static site generator built in Go. However this was not my first choice. Initially I was going to use Jekyll for the simple reason that I had heard of it before and it is what Github uses to power Github Pages. Almost immediately I decided that while Jekyll seems fine to use I did not want to be limited to what Github natively offers, and I didn’t have to.
